definition: to get through the winter
(experienced action marker)
surname Guo
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
winter
(of birds) to migrate south for the winter

sentences.english: A little chook was flying south for the Winter.
sentences.chinese: 一隻小鳥飛到南邊去過冬。

sentences.english: Birds that overwinter in your garden need to find food 365 days of the year.
sentences.chinese: 在你的院子中過冬的鳥類一年365天都需要覓食。

sentences.english: I saw a flight of geese headed south for the winter.
sentences.chinese: 我看到一羣大雁南飛過冬去了。

sentences.english: If you winter there, what do you do for food and drink?
sentences.chinese: 如果在那過冬，你怎麼找喫的喝的？

sentences.english: The squirrel stashes away nuts for winter.
sentences.chinese: 松鼠貯藏胡桃以備過冬。

sentences.english: Jujube also close your eyes to prepare the winter.
sentences.chinese: 棗樹又閉上眼睛準備過冬了。

sentences.english: U. S. dollar had to stop for the winter.
sentences.chinese: 都知道美元在找過冬的墊背。

sentences.english: The largest flock of 3, 000 birds dependson its winter habitat on Poyang Lake.
sentences.chinese: 多達3000只的鶴羣在鄱陽湖過冬。

sentences.english: Every October, white storks fly to the South to spend the winter.
sentences.chinese: 十月的時候，白鸛會陸續飛往南方過冬。

sentences.english: There once was a nonconformist bird that decided not to fly south for the winter.
sentences.chinese: 曾經有一隻不墨守常規的鳥，他決定不飛往南方過冬。

sentences.english: The bear settled in for the winter in its cave.
sentences.chinese: 這頭熊棲身在它的洞裏過冬。

sentences.english: Was counting winter dinners, one a hill.
sentences.chinese: 正數着過冬的糧食，一堆就是一餐飯。

sentences.english: Overwintering anti early rearing of Latrodectus tredecimguttatus baby spiders is the key of artificially rearing the spiders.
sentences.chinese: 間斑寇蛛幼蛛過冬和早期飼養管理是人工飼養的關鍵。

sentences.english: I have a warm nest and I will stay here in the winter.
sentences.chinese: 我把窩墊得暖暖和和的，就在這兒過冬。

sentences.english: The Wehrmacht had no winter uniforms.
sentences.chinese: 納粹國防軍沒有過冬的制服。

sentences.english: They winter the cows in the barn.
sentences.chinese: 他們讓母牛在牲口棚裏過冬。

definition: central heating/heater/warm air
to defend against the cold/to keep warm
to freeze to death/to die off in winter
down-filled garment
down (soft feathers)
to freeze/to feel very cold/aspic or jelly
bitter cold/severe winter
weather
to become cooler/to lower the temperature/cooling/(of interest, activity etc) to decline
packed with people/overcrowded/overpopulation
to freeze
cold weather, frozen ground (idiom); bitterly cold
Harbin, subprovincial city and capital of Heilongjiang province 黑龍江|黑龙江[Hei1 long2 jiang1] in northeast China
to stay for a time/to stop over/to lodge/to sink down (into soft ground)/leftovers
to celebrate the Chinese New Year
nest/pit or hollow on the human body/lair/den/place/to harbor or shelter/to hold in check/to bend/classifier for litters and broods
